description.narrative: Cambodia is perceived to be one of the most corrupt countries in the world and ranked 161 out of 180 countries in Transparency International’s Corruption Perception Index for 2017. Corruption exists at all levels in society, which is characterized by a deeply entrenched culture of patronage. The intervention's intended outcomes are:- Improved democratic governance and enhanced capacity of the public officials on social accountability, integrity and anti-corruption to effectively provide public services;- Strengthened Cambodia’s integrity system to effectively ensure an open government, public sector transparency and better service delivery for the population;- Increased public demand for anti-corruption and enhanced civic participations by all citizens in decisions that affects their lives;- Enhanced capacity of civil society and citizens/youths groups and increased their participation in the fight against corruption more actively;- Well-informed anti-corruption stakeholders and public on the state of governance, sector based studies on corruption issues that affect the lives of people/business community, and implemented ad-hoc emerging corruption cases or abuse of power

Kambodja inledde år 2004 en reform med syfte att stärka den offentliga finansiella styrningen (OFS). Reformen har finansierats av flera givare, däribland EU och Sida. I december 2015 fattade EU-kommissionen beslut om att lämna fortsatt stöd till reformen. Beslutet innebär stöd genom två olika finansieringsmekanismer; sektorbudgetstöd till reformens genomförande samt en delegering till Sida för att finansiera insatser som kompletterar sektorbudgetstödet. Det svenska stödet kommer att riktas till aktörer/områden som inte i tillräcklig omfattning inkluderats i tidigare stöd till OFS-reformen, och som inte med automatik kan nås via EU:s sektorbudgetstöd. Lärdomar från tidigare stöd visar att de mest relevanta områdena för additionellt och riktat stöd handlar om anti-korruption, externrevision, statistik och extern granskning av budgeten. Dessutom har betydelsen av att öka skatteintäkterna och effektiviteten i skatteadministrationen understrukits.
Det svenska stödet kommer att omfatta följande kambodjanska myndigheter och organisationer: Statistikmyndigheten, Skattemyndigheten, Transparency International Cambodia, Riksrevisionen och Parliamentary Institute of Cambodia. Den totala budgeten för det program som ska genomföras av Sida, Partnership for Accountability and Transparency (PAT), är 10,342 miljoner euro. EU:s bidrag uppgår till 7 miljoner euro. Det svenska bidraget uppgår till ca 32 miljoner kronor. Denna insats avser stöd och samarbete med Transparency International Cambodia (TIC).
Transparency International Cambodia (TIC) erhåller ett kärnstöd från ambassaden sedan 2012 med syfte att förebygga och bekämpa korruption i Kambodja. TIC har ansökt om stöd från ambassaden för att fortsätta och fördjupa arbetet med att öka allmänhetens efterfrågan och engagemang avseende anti-korruption samt att förstärka den offentliga och privata sektorns integritet och arbete mot korruption. TIC vill även inkludera nya områden som förstärkt analys och transparens av statsbudgeten och ansöker om USD 3 000 000 för perioden 1 juli 2016 till 30 juni 2019.
Insatsen bedöms vara relevant i förhållande till både svenska och kambodjanska strategier och policies. TIC bedöms ha tillräcklig kapacitet och kompetens för att uppnå de förväntade resultaten. Det förslås att TIC erhåller ett stöd om EUR 1 895 000 samt SEK 8 600 000 för perioden juli 2016 till juni 2019.
Transparency International Cambodia 2016-2019 is a partner for strengthening the public financial management through anti-corruption work and transparency.

tag.narrative: 16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.

description.narrative: Transparency International Cambodia (TIC) has been supported by Sida since its inception in 2012. The intervention is cofounded by EU and Sida and forms one part of the Partnership for Accountability and Transparency (PAT) programme. The current reporting period reflects progress made during the three and a half year of cooperation. A summary of the final results from 2019 are as follows: 1. Enhanced capacity of the Parliament's Commission 10 to oversee the enforcement of the anti-corruption law. TIC has maintained its role as an alternative complaint handling mechanism on corruption cases and continues to assist law enforcement agencies in implementing anti-corruption laws more effectively. - TIC's Advocacy and Legal Advice Centre (ALAC) has offered consultations and legal support to 154 (58 females) clients on 172 corruption and non-corruption cases. - 5 two-days trainings on anti-corruption law and on ALAC's complaint mechanism were conducted with a total of 133 (58 females) sub-national officials, community based organizational leaders, community leaders and youth. - 5 youth-led initiatives were successfully executed by 5 youth groups in 5 different provinces in order to promote ALC and corruption reporting mechanims, reaching 614 (215 females) participants. - Support to improve more transparent and accountable public service delivery at sub-national level with capacity building of 25 trainers, on different topics of good governance at the School of Governance. Another training reached 52 Chiefs (13 females) of 52 District Ombudsmen. 2) Increased demand for budget transparency. TIC contributed to increasing the demand for budget transparency. - Together with the Budget Working Group, where TIC is a core member, a joint statement on macro-economic framework analysis for the draft budget law 2020 was issued. - TIC conducted 8 public forums on budget transparency and accountability at the subnational level which reached, 1 111 (620 females) citizens. - One youth-led intitiative on budget transparency and accountability was carried out directly involving 170 (85 females) citizens/youth. A youth debate competition was organized mobilising 128 youth contestants from 20 universities/schools. 3) Increased participation by youth on anti-corruption. - A total of 8 523 (4 410 females) citizens were engaged in awareness raising and advocacy activities in 2019. - 96 (65 females) youths from 25 provinces were selected to join a fice-day intensive Youth Camp. - 28 youth-led initiatives focusing on budget transparency, public service delivery in health, education, commune services were executed in Phnom Penh and 13 provinces, reaching 4 519 citizens/youths (1 780 females).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
